description: Number of positive solutions to "numbers that are n times sum of their digits".
comments: It appears that the largest terms occur when n=1 mod 9 and moderately large terms when n=4 or 7 mod 9.
example: a(13)=3 since the only three solutions are 117=9*13, 156=12*13 and 195=15*13
maple: read("transforms"):A037478 := proc(n)    local a,x,k;    a := 0 ;    for k from 1 do        x := n*k ;        if digsum(x)*n = x then            a := a+1 ;        end if;        # may stop if x/digsum(x)>n, so if x/#digits(x) > 9*n        if x/A055642(x) > 9*n then            break;        end if;    end do:    a ;end proc:seq(A037478(n),n=1..101) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, May 11 2016
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Sep 12 2000
